<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">[Buffeting Winds](/Spells.aspx?ID=1109)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Air" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=5" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Nonlethal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=188" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Knights of Lastwall](/Sources.aspx?ID=123) pg. 92</row>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 15-foot cone

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** Reflex

</row>

</column>

---

You release a quick burst of wind that batters your living opponents without causing them lasting harm, while also blowing [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) away. The wind deals 2d4 bludgeoning damage, which is [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188) against living creatures. Against undead, the winds are more vicious, and the spell loses the nonlethal trait against such creatures. Each creature in the area must attempt a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. On a failure, undead creatures are also [knocked back](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) 5 feet (or 10 feet on a critical failure).

---
**Heightened (+1)**  The damage increases by 2d4.
name: Buffeting Winds
